definition: to crawl/to climb/to get up or sit up
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
reptiles/also written 爬行動物|爬行动物

sentences.english: The turtle, like all reptiles, is cold-blooded.
sentences.chinese: 海龜和所有爬行動物一樣，是冷血動物。

sentences.english: The types of synapses and synaptic ultrastructures of the rostrolateral area of G. gecko are the same as that of diurnal reptile.
sentences.chinese: 蛤蚧此區突觸類型及超微結構與晝行爬行動物的相同。

sentences.english: Deserts were tidy, because there were no weeds in them, nothing that crawled.
sentences.chinese: 沙漠很整潔，因爲裏面沒有雜草，沒有爬行的東西。

sentences.english: Parthenogenesis is so far known to occur in about 70 reptile species.
sentences.chinese: 迄今已知大約70種爬行動物有單性繁殖行爲。

sentences.english: But birds don't have ‘em, nor do reptiles or fish.
sentences.chinese: 但是鳥類沒有血小板，爬行動物和魚類也沒有。

sentences.english: Crabs can live in water and they walk sideways on land.
sentences.chinese: 螃蟹既能生活在水裏，也能在陸地上橫向爬行。

sentences.english: The Chinese alligator is one of the most endangered reptiles in the world.
sentences.chinese: 揚子鱷是世界上最危險的爬行動物之一。

sentences.english: The Giant Toad and Andean Iguana are some examples of reptiles.
sentences.chinese: 巨型蟾蜍和安地斯山的鬣蜥是爬行動物的代表。

sentences.english: The tank laboriously crawled on with a huddle of soldiers hanging behind.
sentences.chinese: 坦克喫力地爬行着，一堆士兵縮在後面跟着走。

sentences.english: Some reptiles can regrow their tails when they are cut away.
sentences.chinese: 有些爬行動物的尾巴被割掉後可以重新長出來。

sentences.english: Gladiator-inspired sandals are made of reptile-embossed synthetic leather.
sentences.chinese: 角鬥士的靈感涼鞋的爬行動物壓花合成革。

sentences.english: it's the biggest locality of marine reptiles in the world.
sentences.chinese: 那裏堪稱是地球上最大的海洋爬行動物化石產地。

sentences.english: The insect crept under the door.
Such as crawling down, support the body with his elbow alternately crawl as well.
sentences.chinese: 如往下爬行，用胳膊肘支撐身體交替着匍匐前進爲好。

sentences.english: The snake wriggled through the grass.
sentences.chinese: 這條蛇在草裏蜿蜒爬行。

sentences.english: These bugs can run easily and amazingly fast through the sticky hairs.
sentences.chinese: 這些獵椿可以在粘毛間非常輕鬆且快速的爬行。

definition: to crawl/to climb/to get up or sit up
the four limbs of the body
to learn to walk/(fig.) to learn sth, making unsteady progress/to get started on the learning curve
